content: Please provide a [English language grammar rule] that will correct the following sentence: "The cat have five tails."

The sentence "The cat have five tails" contains a subject-verb agreement error. In English grammar, singular subjects require singular verbs, and plural subjects require plural verbs. The subject "The cat" is singular, so the verb should also be singular. Therefore, the correct verb to use is "has" instead of "have."

Corrected sentence: "The cat has five tails."
